【考法 1】 n. 保险措施： a measure taken to preclude loss or injury
【例】 There are so many fail-safes built into the system that a highly unlikely series of mistakes would have to be made before failure could occur.
【近】 caution, palladium, preventive, safeguard
【考法 2】 adj. 保证安全的： having no chance of failure
【例】 a fail-safe device 自动防故障装置
【例】Men have traditionally regarded flowers as the fail-safe gift for Valentine's Day.
【近】 certain, foolproof, sure, unfailing
【反】 fallible 容易犯错的
